intro: Cephalaria armeniaca, commonly known as Armenian cephalaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in conical inflorescences, often with yellow to orange petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
